alert.note: Alert for Franklin (Louisiana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 17 at 6:11PM CDT until May 05 at 9:00AM CDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 700 PM CDT FOR TENSAS...SOUTHWESTERN MADISON...NORTHERN CONCORDIA...NORTHERN CATAHOULA...EASTERN FRANKLIN PARISHES IN NORTHEASTERN LOUISIANA AND NORTHWESTERN JEFFERSON COUNTIES... At 611 PM CDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from 8 miles northwest of Somerset to near Jonesville, moving east at 45 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Hail damage to vehicles is expected. Expect wind damage to roofs, siding, and trees. These severe storms will be near... Somerset and Afton around 620 PM CDT. Frogmore around 625 PM CDT. Other locations impacted by these severe thunderstorms include Harrisonburg, Gilbert, Sicily Island and Ridgecrest. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
